WRITING.TEXT: Because there's no way to transfer ownership of a page. You can delegate updating and posting privileges for the page, but only the owner can make new admins.

Never heard of them, and I've been shopping online for tea for years.
It doesn't seem to indicate how much tea you actually get, so it's hard to say whether it's a good deal or not. In general, I've found that the more effort goes into the design of the tea packaging, the worse value it is.
It's definitely a pretty basic English Breakfast type. I've also found Ahmad teas from Amazon reliable, if not of extremely high quality.

Me too. My wife uses it for her coffee. The one thing I need to remember after she has made her coffee is to let the first few drops (which have a bit of coffee in them) go into a saucer or other cup.

Mine would survive the transfer asleep. We had one disastrous Thanksgiving where we figured they would fall asleep on the drive back from New York to Boston. They didn't. They cried immediately and kept on crying. Somewhere in Connecticut we started calling for hotels, found one, made a mental list of the fifteen different things that needed to come in with us, and then made it in.
tl;dr: it seemed horrible at the time but in retrospect it isn't. And be flexible.

WRITING.TEXT: I use the enterprise version. The Analytics provide you with charts of follower growth, tweets and mentions over time, top-performing links shortened using ow.ly, and tweets by team member. I don't find it hugely useful, because I have other tools for measuring the things I care about. But for the right person, it would be very useful to have in one place.
